author: Get News
title: Empowering the Future of Medicine: Announcing the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors Winner | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
Dr. Mahmud Kara Valley View, Ohio - Dr. Mahmud Kara , a distinguished medical practitioner with over three decades of experience, is thrilled to announce the recipient of the inaugural Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors. This esteemed scholarship, established in recognition of Dr. Kara's remarkable contributions to the medical field, aims to nurture visionary minds in medicine.
The Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors offers undergraduate students across the nation a unique opportunity to showcase their innovative ideas and commitment to transforming healthcare. With a generous one-time award of $1,000, this scholarship not only honors academic excellence but also celebrates the potential impact that emerging doctors can have on the global healthcare landscape.
As part of the application process, the winner participated in an engaging essay contest, where they demonstrated their innovative approaches to healthcare and their commitment to positive change in the field.
The Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors serves as a beacon of hope and opportunity for aspiring medical professionals, transcending mere monetary recognition. Beyond its financial support, this scholarship embodies a profound commitment to nurturing the next wave of healthcare visionaries and leaders. It signifies a dedication to fostering a culture of excellence, compassion, and innovation within the medical community.
By providing this scholarship, Dr. Mahmud Kara aims to inspire and empower young minds to push the boundaries of conventional medicine, encouraging them to explore new avenues of research, treatment modalities, and patient care practices. This commitment to innovation is essential in addressing the evolving challenges and complexities of modern healthcare.
Moreover, the scholarship fosters a sense of community and collaboration among recipients, creating a network of like-minded individuals who share a passion for advancing healthcare and improving patient outcomes. Through mentorship, networking opportunities, and ongoing support, recipients of the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors are encouraged to continue their journey of growth and development as compassionate healers and change-makers in the field of medicine.
Ultimately, this scholarship is not just about recognizing academic achievement; it is about investing in the future of healthcare. It is about nurturing the potential of young doctors to become leaders who will drive positive change, improve access to quality care, and make meaningful contributions to the well-being of individuals and communities worldwide. In this way, the Dr. Mahmud Kara Scholarship for Future Doctors embodies a profound commitment to shaping a brighter, healthier future for all.
Please join us in congratulating our winner for their outstanding achievement and in celebrating the bright future they embody for the field of medicine.
About Dr. Mahmud Kara :
Dr. Mahmud Kara is a highly esteemed medical professional with over three decades of experience. In 2017, he founded KaraMD, an online platform dedicated to supporting digestive health, heart health, and overall well-being. Dr. Kara's commitment to advancing medical knowledge and empowering future doctors continues to inspire individuals globally.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Campbell County residents, officials push back against BLM's proposed coal leasing change
text:
By Jonathan Gallardo Gillette News Record Via Wyoming News Exchange ,
2 hours ago
GILLETTE — The Campbell County commissioners are planning to push back against a proposed rule by the federal government that would essentially end coal leasing in the Powder River Basin.
Tuesday, at a public hearing during the commissioners’ regular meeting, local residents and government officials voiced their concerns and frustrations with the Bureau of Land Management, which in May announced its intent to not allow any new federal coal leases.
The plan targets the Powder River Basin and its 12 Wyoming coal mines, which are all located in Campbell County, and would allow mines to operate through 2041 under current leases.
Commissioner Jim Ford said this rule has been more than eight years in the making and that this decision will “project an end date for mining in our community.”
Commission Chair Del Shelstad said coal production in Campbell County has sent billions of dollars to the state over the years.
"That’s why we expect the state of Wyoming to start this fight with us and help us with this," he said. "I can trust that they’re smart enough to do this."
Commissioners will be submitting a protest letter, and they are asking Campbell County residents to sign an online petition, which is available at tinyurl.com/yeyn686d .
Gillette Mayor Shay Lundvall said the city will “stand shoulder to shoulder” with the county to fight this proposal and keep coal leasing alive.
Rep. John Bear, R-Gillette, said Campbell County needs to go on the offensive.
“I don’t believe this (Biden) administration is interested in listening to the complaints and objections,” he said.
He said this fight needs to happen in court and that Wyoming needs to lead that fight and “do it in such a serious way that they quit picking on Wyoming.”
Rep. Chris Knapp, R-Gillette, said this “won’t be the last of it,” adding that there only will be more rule changes coming from the federal government that will make life harder in Wyoming.
Gillette resident Mark Junek said there’s “too much complacency in our community” on this issue, and that the BLM rule change will affect everyone, even if they’re not directly working in the coal industry.
George Dunlap said Gillette wouldn’t be the community it is today if people decades ago had sat back instead of taking action. He said he’s hopeful about the effects the presidential election could have.
“Who knows what’s going to happen if Donald Trump gets elected, we may have a chance to save this country, we may have a chance to save Wyoming and save Campbell County,” he said.

organizations.name: gillette news record via wyoming news exchange

author: 記者江睿智／台北報導
title: 零售、餐飲業表現 同期最佳
text:
聯合新聞網 零售、餐飲業表現 同期最佳 閱讀全文
記者江睿智／台北報導 2025年4月23日 下午3:42 經濟部昨（23）日發布3月零售業 營業額 3,930億元，餐飲業營業額855億元，雙創歷年同月新高，分別年增0.4%及2.8%，顯示內需依然熱絡。
業界擔憂在美國對等關稅政策下，不僅經濟成長不確定大增，也可能推升物價，導致下半年消費買氣縮手，對此經濟部統計處副處長黃偉傑表示，仍有待觀察，且業者可能持續推出促銷，4月清明連假、5月母親節檔期，加上新商場加入，可望維持消費動能，預計零售餐飲業4月營業額將續成長。
經濟部統計，3月零售業營業額3,930億元，年增0.4%。其中量販店年增11%、超級市場年增8.9%、便利商店年增4%、百貨公司營業額年減1%。黃偉傑分析，台中新光三越火災事件對百貨業績衝擊愈來愈小，加上4月有新賣場加入，會淡化衝擊。預期4月零售業營業額成長0.4%至3.4%。
餐飲業3月營業額855億元，年增2.8%，其中餐館及飲料店受惠新品牌及店數擴增，聯名新品與優惠活動挹注，分別年增2.3%及1.2%；外燴及團膳承包業因航班旅運人次增加，航餐需求擴增，年增13.9%。第1季營業額2,740億元，年增3.7%。估4月餐飲業成長2.2%至5.2%。
【看原文連結】
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
